Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring



â€¦more

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

FUNDRAISING INTERNSHIP AT GREEN BHUMI About Green Bhumi : Green Bhumi is a vibrant platform dedicated to fostering environmentalconsciousness and action globally. At the heart of our initiative, lies theestablishment and promotion of Environmentalism andfosteringcommunity engagement through impactful environmental activism. Green Bhumi is a flagship project (initiative) under the Top TroveFoundation that envisions a life free from pollution and enriched withfresh air. Our mission is to inspire and empower communities to plant trees, harnessing nature's positive impact on lives while contributing tosocio-economic well-being. About the Internship : We are looking for passionate and proactive FUNDRAISING INTERNSwho can raise funds by reaching out to their personal and socialnetworks, including friends, family, neighbours, and communities. Thisrole offers an opportunity to make a tangible impact by helpingGreenBhumi achieve its goals through grassroots fundraising. Duration : 15 days Type : Remote/Work From Home Internship Stipend : Unpaid Internship Key Responsibilities: â— Approach friends, family, neighbours, and acquaintances to raisefunds for GreenBhumi's initiatives. â— Educate potential donors about GreenBhumiâ€™s mission and theimpact of their contributions. â— Utilize personal and social networks (offline and online) tomaximize fundraising efforts. â— Maintain accurate records of donations received and ensure timelyreporting.â— Work closely with the fundraising team to meet targets andstrategize new approaches. Requirements : â— Strong communication and persuasion skills. â— A proactive and confident approach to fundraising. â— Socially active with good networking abilities. â— Passion for environmental and social causes. â— Self-motivated, responsible, and result-oriented. â— Prior experience in Fundraising Domain will be a plus Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion â— Letter of Recommendation (performance based). â— Promotions at the Internship â— Recognition on Social Media (performance based) â— Hands-on experience in grassroots fundraising and networking. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and create socialimpact. â— Flexible working hours to suit your schedule. Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

FUNDRAISING INTERNSHIP AT GREEN BHUMI About Green Bhumi : Green Bhumi is a vibrant platform dedicated to fostering environmentalconsciousness and action globally. At the heart of our initiative, lies theestablishment and promotion of Environmentalism andfosteringcommunity engagement through impactful environmental activism. Green Bhumi is a flagship project (initiative) under the Top TroveFoundation that envisions a life free from pollution and enriched withfresh air. Our mission is to inspire and empower communities to plant trees, harnessing nature's positive impact on lives while contributing tosocio-economic well-being. About the Internship : We are looking for passionate and proactive FUNDRAISING INTERNSwho can raise funds by reaching out to their personal and socialnetworks, including friends, family, neighbours, and communities. Thisrole offers an opportunity to make a tangible impact by helpingGreenBhumi achieve its goals through grassroots fundraising. Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring

Are your seniors ğ’…ğ’Šğ’‚ğ’ğ’ğ’ğ’…ğ’” ğ’ğ’“ ğ’‡ğ’ğ’”ğ’”ğ’Šğ’ğ’”?Fossils warm the same chair for 10 years & dismiss freshers, "This generation is not committed only, in our times..." Diamonds show not tell. They make 10 years look purposeful, not just stressful. If YOU are wearing 'loyalty' as a badge on your chest, ask yourself:1ï¸âƒ£ When was the last time someone tried to poach you due to your skills and reputation? Your lack of opportunity is not loyalty. 2ï¸âƒ£ Have you backed your career-car into a corner you can't reverse from & are pretending this is where you wanted to park all along?3ï¸âƒ£ If you care so much, how many times have you stuck your neck out? Called out gaps? Gone against the highest-paid person's opinion at the risk of short-term conflict?4ï¸âƒ£ Are you loyal to the company for what they do or because the brand name looks good on a CV/ in society? Being loyal to a top brand is easy - you know you can't do better  - so you settle for a level of despair you can tolerate and call it happiness. 5ï¸âƒ£ Are you afraid of starting over because you fear failure? Is your only career insurance the fact that you get along with your manager? Do you gang up against high-potential new joinees who want to do things in a way that discomforts you?'See, Loyalty is honourable and what every boss / company wants. But please stop pretending you are loyal to the company when your true loyalty is only to avoiding discomfort, acing optics, intellectual complacency and the EMIs on a fancy new car. hashtag#Career hashtag#Culture hashtag#Retention hashtag#Team hashtag#Hiring
